content: the front needle now we stitch on the back needle purlwise through the first stitch slipping it off the needle and knitwise through the next stitch repeat until all stitches have been worked the pattern cuff & leg 1 with the smaller needles cast on 36 40 48 sts using your preferred method in the samples i used a long tail cast on pm and join to knit in the round knit using 1x1 rib for 1 1 5 2 5 inches switching to larger needles knit every row until sock measure 5 5 7 8 inches from cast on edge heel flap 2 working flat turning for every row separate the next 18 20 24 st to work the heel flap row 1 rs sl1 k1 * repeat row 2 ws sl1 p to end row 3 sl1 sl1 k1 * repeat to last st k1 row 4 sl1 p to end repeat these 4 row for a total of 16 18 22 row ending with either row 2 or 4 heel turn 3 we ll be turning the corner of the sock using short row row 1 rs sl1 k10 12 14 ssk k1 turn row 2 ws sl1 p5 7 7 p2tog p1 turn row 3 sl1 k to one st before the gap ssk k1 turn row 4 sl1 p to one at before the gap p2tog p1 turn repeat row 3 & 4 until all the stitches have been worked the pattern gusset 4 slip the first stitch knit across the heel pick up and k10 11 13 sts along the side of the heel flap tip pickup each of the slipped stitches and one stitch in the ladder between the heel flap and the remaining stitches pm knit across the top of the foot stitches pm pick up and k10 11 13 sts along the side of the heel flap k6 7 8 and place bor marker located on the bottom of the foot 50 56 66 st row 1 knit to 3 st before first marker k2tog k1 sm knit to next marker sm k1 ssk k remaining sts row 2 knit slipping all the markers repeat these 2 row until 36 40 48 sts remain foot & toe 5 knit until foot reaches 1 1 5 1 75 inches shorter and than desired length you can start trying on your sock to get the perfect length start toe decreases as followed row 1 knit to 3 st before first marker k2tog k1 sm knit to next marker sm k1 ssk k to end of row row 2 knit repeat these 2 row 2 3 5 times repeat row 1 2 more times for all sizes 20 stitches cut approximately 12 inches of yarn and graft remaining stitches together using the kitchener stitch congratulations you re finished repeat
